About.title: My Journey
BeginningCarpentryDesc: I started my career in carpentry school, learning the fundamentals of woodworking, precision tools, and measurements.
More than just technical skills, this experience taught me discipline, punctuality, and a strong attention to detail—qualities that continue to shape my approach to work.
ProfessionalExperienceDesc: After graduating, I spent four years on construction sites, collaborating with experienced carpenters. This hands-on experience strengthened my problem-solving abilities and adaptability.

Every day, teamwork and clear communication were essential to ensuring smooth project execution. Through these challenges, I developed patience and perseverance—two qualities that now define my approach to coding.
TransitionWebDevDesc: Looking for a new challenge, I enrolled in an intensive 8-month ACS program in web development. The fast-paced curriculum demanded dedication, and by the end, only a dozen students remained out of the original 30.

While I enjoyed carpentry, the industry's rigid structure and physical demands made me reconsider my path. The opportunity to transition into tech—where creativity, logic, and continuous learning thrive—was exactly what I needed.
About.SkillDevelopmentDesc: Throughout 2023, I refined my skills in React through online courses, explored Java, and secured a job, which helped me solidify my focus on Front-end development. Finding my first position wasn't easy, but every challenge and interview provided valuable lessons that strengthened my motivation and skills. I held this position until the end of 2024, gaining significant experience and further refining my expertise in web development.
About.ReadyForImpactDesc: Now, I'm available and eager to apply my expertise and problem-solving mindset to meaningful projects, contributing to innovative and impactful development work!
